Our latest scientific understanding of quantum entanglement and nonlocality are now accepted science with the award of the 2022 Nobel Prize in physics.

This interdependence with all life of our technology driven human project is a consequence of the human appropriation of 25-40% of Net Primary Productivity (HANPP), the measure of the entire planet’s biological production.
We need look no further than our system of industrial agriculture, fishery and forestry management, and our ever-expanding urbanization to understand the predicament facing humanity.
There are no unsacred places. There are only sacred places and desecrated places.
The Italian Renaissance followed the Black Death that devastated medieval Europe between 1348 and 1350.
Florence’s population was nearly halved in one year, wreaking unimaginable terror.
Renaissance, meaning “rebirth,” represented a revival of classical learning.
Renaissance, meaning “rebirth,” represented a revival of classical learning, and the embrace of a new humanism, the arts and sciences, and geographical exploration.

relationships.target: dogma of the Roman Catholic Church
relationships.context: The Renaissance would then usher in the scientific revolution, a direct rejection of the dogma of the Roman Catholic Church and its corruption.
The Modern Era was born. The West would be the home of unprecedented progress based on extraordinary discoveries in science.
But of course, the Modern Era also had its shadow of colonialism, slavery, and the extractive othering of all life.
But of course, the Modern Era also had its shadow of colonialism, slavery, and the extractive othering of all life.
But of course, the Modern Era also had its shadow of colonialism, slavery, and the extractive othering of all life.
The progress of modernity was built on a Newtonian or mechanistic understanding of reality, referred to metaphorically as the “clockwork universe.”
As complexity scientist Stu Kauffman likes to say, Sir Issac Newton literally taught us (in the West) how to think.
inclusive of neoclassical economics, the theory by which we manage the global economy and international relations.
At the heart of the economics discipline is the absurd assumption that exponential growth can go on forever on a finite planet.
Taylorism, the so called “scientific management” theory by which we run most of our business enterprises, is also built on a Newtonian foundation.
Enterprises can be optimized and managed by “key performance indicators.”
Using the method of reductionism, we learned to break complex wholes down into parts.
As a result, our academies are broken down into specialist disciplines.
our governing bodies are broken down into specialist ministries.
What we call the “scientific method” is in fact largely this same reductionist method.
Agronomist and Right Livelihood Award winner Wes Jackson puts it this way
